snippet.title: Man tasered and shot by NSW Police in Grafton dies in Gold Coast hospital
snippet.content: A man has died after being shot by police at Grafton on the New South Wales mid north coast yesterday afternoon. Police were called to a unit on Turf Street about 4pm following reports of a disturbance The man allegedly confronted officers with a knife, before they discharged a Taser and then shot him. He was taken to Grafton Hospital in a critical condition before being flown to Gold Coast University Hospital, where he died. Police say a critical incident investigation is underway. More to come.
